 I can see quite a few positive things with the UN. Humanitarian aid being perhaps the most obvious. But also things like attempting to uphold the westphalian order (even though the current US administration seems to do their best to spoil this), providing a platform for international debate and agreements, being able to legitimize and facilitate actions and decissions, empowering watch-dog organisations like amnesty, conducting cross-country studies etc, etc.
 
 But I guess there are a few bad things or failiures as well (like the "oil for food scandal"), but I don`t really see how the bad would outweigh the good.
Errr... I think the correct spelling should be Untied Nations. They haven't ever been united on anything as far as I know.

 If the two members decide to respond with quicker, real-time posts rather than the structured 5/4 style, I would suggest a time limit to wrap up the debate, perhaps 2-3 weeks. If additional time is desired, I wouldn't be averse to it, if the opponent felt so inclined also.
